name: need-satisfaction
description: How entities pursue and satisfy their needs over time

setup.description: Run simulation for 2000+ ticks, track need levels and satisfaction events

expectations.behavior: Needs decay at reasonable rates - rest becomes pressing around 800 ticks of activity
expectations.eval_hint: Track rest need over time for active entity - should approach 0.8 around tick 800

expectations.behavior: Entities proactively address needs before they become critical (0.8+), not just reactively
expectations.eval_hint: Count how many times entities satisfy needs at 0.5-0.7 vs 0.8+ - should see proactive behavior

expectations.behavior: No entity dies from starvation or exhaustion if food/rest actions are available - system works
expectations.eval_hint: If entity has food need at 1.0 and food_available=true, they should be eating

expectations.behavior: Safety need recovers when no threats present - entities don't stay permanently scared
expectations.eval_hint: After threat removed, safety need should decay toward 0.0 at ~0.01/tick

expectations.behavior: Social and purpose needs build slowly - entities can go 2000+ ticks without crisis
expectations.eval_hint: Social/purpose should be the last needs to hit critical, not the first

expectations.behavior: Actions actually satisfy needs - eating reduces food need, resting reduces rest need
expectations.eval_hint: Before/after need values when action completes - should see meaningful reduction

expectations.behavior: Busy ant colony feel - entities always doing something, needs create natural activity cycles
expectations.eval_hint: Population should show mix of activities at any snapshot - not all resting or all working
